TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract DocReturnEventObject implements class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.DocReturnEvent

Docs.summary: An event object that is used during a Microsoft InfoPath load or submission event.

remarks.para: This type is a wrapper for a coclass that is required by managed code for COM interoperability. Use this type to access the members of the COM interface implemented by this coclass. For information about the COM interface, including a link to descriptions of its members, see.

The DocReturnEvent object provides the property that can be used within a load or submission event to programmatically interact with the data in a form's underlying XML document. It also provides the property that is used to specify whether the event is successful.
The DocReturnEvent object is passed as a parameter to the event and the event of an InfoPath form. The properties that it provides are available only during these events.

example.para: In the following example, the property of the DocReturnEvent object is used to display the source XML of a form's underlying XML document using the DOM property of the object:
